bibl.title: Letter from Bertha L. Lyons to Frank F. Law, March 2, 1948

div1.p: Lyons thanks Law for referring her to Roley, who will provide inserts for the Hall of Fame program.

div1.head: Letter from Bertha L. Lyons to Frank F. Law, March 2, 1948
div1.opener:
Every American is a shareholder in the Hall of Fame
HALL OF FAME : NEW YORK UNIVERSITY
I MADISON AVENUE · NEW YORK IO, N. Y.
2 March 1948
Telephone: MURRAY HILL 3-4469
Dear Mr. Law:
div1.p:
I am indeed beholden to you for referring me to
Mr. Roley with reference to the reproduction of Dean Cornwell's
painting “Conquerors of Yellow Fever” in our program for May 20.

After explaining the entire matter to Mr. Roley, he has
kindly consented to furnish inserts for our program of the
proper dimensions, and with the necessary explanatory notes.
We think this a very gracious gesture and I wish to reiterate
my deep appreciation of your helpfulness in the matter.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Bertha L. Lyons
Assistant to the Director BLL:yz
Mr. Frank Law, Vice-President
Wyeth, Inc.
1600 Arch Street
Philadelphia 3, Pennsylvania
Send to Dr Hench
Dear Doctor: From the above
You will note we have taken care
of the Hall of Fame. We are sending Miss
Lyons 5000 color reproductions
Frank Law
